content: How are supposed to trace the virus if the app is not compatible with older Android version .you need to have at least Android version 8 . That's very not smart.

Battery drainer. The only way to reasonably use the app is to turn it on around others. Otherwise, not a "set it, forget it" solution. The overall function of the app is clearly explained, and is fine to use when needed. No crashes, flawless app persistence.

While well intended, this app is useless. First of all it depends on the person with a positive test to voluntarily upload this information. Secondly, shouldn't a person with a positive test be self isolating for 14 days, in which case he/she shouldn't be exposed to anyone. I would be surprised if this app has actually registered exposure to anyone. This app needs more work. I'm uninstalling it.
HELP Honestly the app doesn't work at all for me. I hit "upload data" and it doesn't send a pin. This app has been sub-par but I still have it downloaded.
First time code didn't work. Now stuck at that point. Should be option to resend a code.

I have a 3 years old phone & I've had no problem with my battery. When keeping Bluetooth on, in a 12 hour period the battery usage was only 0.7%. My only complaint is that it shows an icon in my status bar regardless if Bluetooth is on or off. Personally I would prefer that the icon only shows when Bluetooth is off. Until we get the National app here at least it's one thing I can do. Who knows when we'll get the National one!?! Hopefully sooner than later!
Absolute garbage. It doesn't stay active on your phone. I have to restart my phone when I'm out and about several times so absolutely no point. Doesn't work.

I like to have the App to protect myself. I feel more confident wherever i go knowing that if iam exposed to the virus i will be informed immediately and that way i can be tested and get the treatment i need. Thank you

It's irritating that it has a large notification on my screen all the time to note that it's running, rather than an icon, or the option to just run in the background without that. Worse, it drains my battery, using as much power as almost everything else I run combined. I'd like to use it, but this isn't feasible.
It's an absolute battery drainer! The intentions are good and the existence of it is important but it's just killing my battery and my phone is brand new.
Extreme battery usage on a Pixel 2. Want to keep it don't know what to do

The idea behind this is great. But the implementation eats battery like candy. And there's no way to temporarily turn it off. I'd love to be able to turn it off while I'm driving or when I'm backpacking in PLUZ areas no where near another human. So because my phone having battery is more important when I'm in the middle of no where I'm uninstalling.
It doesn't drain my battery like others say. Not sure why others are having issues...?
Eats batter, very very badly. 45% battery usage over 2 hrs.
Battery Drainer!!!! Wow does this app eat battery!! What good is it to trace and notify me if my battery is dead?
Please listen to everyone and make an on/off option. This only needs to be on when we go out in public and will just be an added step such as bringing a mask.
No issues with the app (Samsung Note 9).
Badly developed. Developer did not enter code correctly as several functions are not operational. Not sure where the mo ey went?
I have not had any problems at all aside from the battery drain which I solved by turning off my Bluetooth at home and turning it on while I am out.

I live in Alberta but my phone number is fron Mexico (starts with +52). Please add other phone number options because I can't use the app without having a +1 phone number and I don't have one. I'm sure I'm not the only one.
The app hasn't been updated in six weeks, but it suddenly started draining my battery the past couple days. No explanation why that's happening now.
Such a battery hog! The federal one doesn't need as much battery as this one. Fix it if you want more people to use it.
Terrible app, can't even register.
Won't let me sign up. Uninstalled then reinstalled, now there's an error message when adding phone number.
The app keeps asking me to restart my phone 10 times per hour. Please fix it.
Needs to run in foreground. When app crashes user has to manually restart. Drain on battery. This is not a good solution. Better to switch to the new Health Canada app called COVID Alert.
Trash propaganda.
I am getting warnings that the app is overloading the CPU. Also drains the battery. I am deleting this app now.
Depletes battery very quickly. I use my phone a lot for a number apps. This thing would account for around 70% battery usage.
Works like garbage. Just install the government of Canada one: much slicker interface, more people using it, no battery issues.
Drains the battery on my phone
Its pretty useless
I like this app because it will inform me if I've been in contact with anybody that has this virus because I definitely do not want to get it thank you
Runs consistently in the background, not a serious drain on battery.

This app, while it has good intentions, is a battery killer. If you do not have frequent access to charge your phone multiple times per day then be warned as this app can consume 20+% of your battery just running in the background. I have seen it as high as 57% on my S9+. I will be deleting this app as my phone is only a tool to communicate against COVID-19. Wear a mask!
High battery usage. No off button. Needs an auto off geofence option so it doesn't kill the battery at home.
Drains my battery! Hardly lasts half a day now. But because of my work I feel it important to have this app on my phone.
This things drains battery real quick
Covid 19

Was excited for the app, until i find out it only records ppl in contact longer than 15min. Thats bs and useless, it takes less than 15seconds to infect someone. Uninstalled, thx. With so few people downloading this app, having this on my phone is a joke. Update: i have been getting spam calls nonstop since i provided my phone # for this app, is my info really secure???
What the hell....blue tooth.....use something else....not a battery eater.....there better tracking and tracing in Facebook....or my cellphone Waste of tax money
Finally figured out what was draining my battery...this app!! Using almost 10 times the battery that my social media apps use, combined!
It's neither good or bad. It just sits in the background. I can only assume it works.

needs an off button holy moly I believed all the battery drain hype, especially since I'm a server at a restaurant I just leave my phone plugged in at the front desk and it's not a problem (heats up a bit tho). when I get home however it's worse because it was charging all day consuming power-at-will. the choice for me is to turn off background activity on the app in the settings when I get home. there's no sense in exchanging keys with my fam 24hrs a day. but I could easily forget it off :/
Always working. Dont even know it's on unless I check. No noticable battery drain. App is being improved. No privacy issues. Do your part.
Authentication is not sending text message before but is now working for me.
Battery Drain! Went into work with 96% battery. After 5 hours of no use my phone was dead when it would normally be in the low 90s - high 80s depending on I my data was turn on or not.
I tried to get the code numerous times and it never works. Waist of time
Security risk. Another ucp failure.

Here's a tip; if my device can see yours via Bluetooth, there's a good chance I can access your device and everything on it using an apk like Superblue. Don't be an idiot. This is exploitable Traceware.
Takes way too much battery life. 39% over 4 hours....
Started to drain my battery of my fairly new phone.
Can't connect to car without uninstalling. Ridiculous as it intereferes with other bluetooth so how can I even use it. Can't use it if I need bluetooth.
Allow me to turn off bluetooth when at home or better yet, have a home zone that automatically turns bluetooth off and I'll put it back on my phone. Too invasive.
Ir drains my battery big time
Unable to activate. Installs okay but when asking for cell phone number it always says the server is down for the last month.

I noticed the last 2 days this app has been draining my battery. Use to have 45% left at bedtime, now only 10% at 1 pm. Just did the update, which I didn't know about. So hopefully it fixes this battery issue. (03-Jun-20). UPDATE: After the update the app no longer drained my battery. I noticed a drain on my battery again today (06-Jul-20) and checked for an update, which there was. If you notice your battery being drained, just update the app.

I want to keep this app but it's draining my battery. It seemed okay the first few weeks of using it but recently it's been overheating my phone. I checked my battery usage and it says this app is using 44% of my battery. Doesn't seem feasible to keep running it if I'm going to have to keep my phone on a charger most of the day.
I originally thought the app was draining my battery but it turned out to be something else. It seems to work fine and is unobtrusive except for the always on tray notification.
I barely go outside, so all it did was eat my battery throughout the day. Even if I went outside, I never got a notification from the app.
dont like it didnt do anything to help me wast of time

5 stars but still......Google maps tracks your phone -where, when- what time and exact place literally on a bus, anyone with a Gmail account, their GPS or location setting on their Android or Apple phone can access their location history, even your commands to Ok Google. and easily share this information with health officials if the time arises. Just thought I'd point that out.

Only installing for long periods of exposure It seems to cause overheating with my phone. If I have the app installed (paused or unpaused) it seems to ramp up internal temps. Also, there should be an option to say you are at home, so you don't have to pause the app. The constant need to have BT on, even while at home, is annoying. I get why but it is frustrating.
I don't huv any pinyon
Installed it. Hope I'll need to use it!
This app is a terrible battery drain. I had to uninstall to keep battery more than a few hours.
I uninstalled the ap due to high battery usage from the app.
Works well on S10, no issues to report here. Impressive beard illustrations to boot!

I'm sure this a great service to use. The only issue I have is having Bluetooth on all the time. It drained my battery by 60% in 10 hours while I was at work. I'm out in the community a lot, so I would need to keep it on for it to be useful.
I had this a few days after release and didn't feel the usefulness. But it kept draining my battery. 39% use compared to all other apps. My battery kept heating up. Uninstalled.
Had it for a whole 20 minutes, battery went from 100% to 90% Im all for tracking it, but the app is kinda pointless if my phone is dead and I cant get notifactions
Anybody else have to uninstall this app cause it makes your phone glitchy and kills the battery?
Wanted to help prevent the spread of covid. This app is garbage. Used 76% of my phone battery in 12 hours. Uninstalled. Now we are all gonna get covid.
Bring app please to every one mandatory.

This app is 100% not anonymous, it starts out by asking for your phone number, which allows the government to get your name and then track you. If you care at all about your privacy do not install this app. There is no need to provide your phone number for what they have proposed the goal of this app to be. They could have notified you within the app.
Caused my battery to drain much faster, deleted!
Need to be able to turn off when I'm home
I have entered my phone number but no six digit code has been sent to me. I am stuck in step 1 of the process. Update: app is working now. Great app.
Your app is over heating and draining the battery of my phone so bad and had nvr told me anything other then keep the app open
Battery killer, but worth running if you can. Please add support for Androids "COVID-19 exposure notifications"
Doesn't stay active. Will disappear sporadically and you have to restart your phone to make it appear again. I've gone days before I realize it's gone again so what's the point?
I want to understand why the app needs permission to location data when the app description says they don't collect it. Is there any reasonable explanation?

I was using this, but can't anymore. My battery dropped from 70% to 10% in an hour - all due to this app. Whatever was changed recently needs to be reverted. I had to uninstall as it made my phone unusable. According to my battery usage analysis, this app used 50.2% of my battery life. Next highest usage was an app at 2.1%.

I would have really liked to use this to help out but my battery life is non-existent. I just got a new S10 and my battery died a little over halfway through the day. If they could somehow fix this app to turn off when you're not moving or something then maybe it wouldn't drain your battery so bad? No idea, but I had to uninstall it.

This app is supposed to run in the background with a notification that it's still running. Well, it won't stay running on my phone. So it's pretty much useless if every 20 minutes I have to open the app to make sure it's still working on my phone. I'd give it zero stars if I could. P.o.s.

This should also include covid 19 stats available at AHS website. Push notifications for outbreaks of chosen locations by the user or if there is any change in current restrictions. Info on current public health order, public health guidance. Latest news and announcements (ie. Change in testing policies, etc), provide relevant links (ie. Biz connect), then it may encourage people to install it.
Battery drain.

Phone - Essential PH-1 I don't know if it's just me, but my phone heats up quite spectacularly, draining the battery. The app also has huge buttons and small text, and literally has a huge button saying NEXT----> with small text above it saying don't press unless asked to. I haven't used it long enough to get any results, but with the issues immediately apparent, I don't recommend it.

You may want to look at power usage. Depending on how close I am to another phone? my phone chews through its battery. Sitting with my wife at home and in less than 5 hours, it ate through 45% of my battery. Prior to the installation of ABTraceTogether, I never used my battery up in a day; sometimes would get two days. It is also heating my phone up due to excessive battery usage. Please resolve this issue so I do not need to uninstall the app.
Install was very easy. Done in under 2 minutes. App is a great idea for the times. Having said that, yes the battery drain is amazing. Started as a 5 but now a 3. I wish it was more.

Greetings to anyone who reads this, If the app is only getting a 3.0 (3 Stars), is there a problem with it? Please consider the following, none of which is/are (a) conspiracy theory/theories. I can say this because countless independent studies done across the world have all found these phenomena to be true. 1. Are delusional naysayers about the Covid-19 pandemic keeping the app from scoring higher by not subscribing to it? ; or 2. Is the low rating the possible result of most of the current subscribers not getting alerts, and that others - who haven't (yet) subscribed to the app - are being lulled into a false sense of safety, even complacency? ; or, 3. Is the app a bit of a lame-duck technology - on the part of the government - and the app is not functioning properly or at all? ; or, 4. Are Albertans simply complacent about the pandemic? Go into any store which has clearly defined and labelled "shopping lanes" and other forms of signage, along with PA and public service announcements exhorting shoppers to abide by the store's rules and Alberta Health's guidelines, and you'll experience first-hand what I'm talking about. Indifference, obtuse behaviour, willful or blind ignorance, etc. ; or, finally (at least for now) 5. Is the media, which continues to feed us only what is "news worthy" to it (as it has done for nearly 3 generations), the real problem? If the app is not being kept in front of viewers or in the ears of listeners, is that the reason for the low rating? The media, along with government, controls the access to news. More often than not, it's the media doing this because "news worthy" really means that which attracts and is supported by the most lucrative advertising revenue streams. As CFCN says "All the news you need to know", which translates, "All the news we want you to hear". CBC, CTV, and the American networks on cable and satellite TV are all complicit in this. I'll stop now, since I've run out of time to continue. However, I must add that if the government is truly engaged in leading Albertans out of this tragedy, it will not alter, delete, expunge, rephrase, or in any other way, edit my comments because some of them have suggested government shortcomings. I'm keeping a copy of this for my own files and for posterity. Clayton Walls, Calgary June 11, 2020 @ 1300 h MDT
This app was fine for a few weeks then all of the sudden started eating the battery life. No idea why. I had to uninstall because I was no longer making it through the work day with enough battery.

The principle is good and I'd really like to help by using this app but a week after installing it, my battery is drained before the afternoon is over. I have to uninstall. When the developers can make it more efficient in power usage I'd be happy to install it again
Brand new phone and totally drains my battery. Had to uninstall, sadly 😞

I've had no complaints up until a couple of days ago when my phone indicated that AB Trace Together has been using 35.6% of my battery, while at home. I disabled Bluetooth and it didn't change or conserve the battery. My phone has been on for 20 minutes this morning and its already used 6.1% of my battery. Prior to this, battery usage was negligible. Updated it and hoping that helps.

I so want to help by having the app but the battery drain is frustrating to deal with. At the start a few weeks ago it seemed like there was no issue but over the past two days, after going out twice, my battery is just kaput in an outrageously short period of time. I'm talking from full charge down to 10 percent in a span of 7 hours, of which 5 of those hours was spent being in battery saving mode and idle. I hope the update fixes this or retaining this app will be untenable.

Well designed app that has had no adverse effect on battery life! When I first got it I was force closing it when not out to conserve battery. I decided to test leaving it on 24/7 and over two days I couldn't see any extra battery consumption. I was honestly shocked and have left it on since. Also really like that this app DOESN'T use GPS only my Bluetooth to see who I've been in contact with instead of tracking my every movement.
Just an overhyped app. Bluetooth always need to on. Drain battery faster
Drains battery life.
I'd like to support this app but recently it's been killing my phone's battery. Looking at the details it's 94% of my battery life.
Need a start stop button to turn off when home with out having to go to settings. , burns battery and data.
Uses so much battery. I normally go through 75% battery on an average day and with this app I have to recharge half way through the day. 10 days running
A little trouble with the 2 Step Verification Code.

Kills your battery way to quickly. Not what i was expecting at all either was hoping for more information maybe even to show where the hot spots were for infected people. Fells more like a way to track where you are and what your doing.

It's quite respectful of privacy, and uses very little of the battery on my Pixel 3. But please start supporting the new Google and Apple contact tracing API! Since it isn't user friendly on iPhones, less iPhone users will use it, and then it's less effective for us Android users too. What essential worker with an iPhone would leave their phone on for an 8-hour shift? I'd give it 5 stars if it wasn't such a deterrent to iPhone users.
I think the idea is great as long as it's executed properly however there seems to be a glitch with the app as it's used 33% of my battery so far today.
Error when entering phone number can't use

Just got a notification from my cell "some apps or processes are overloading the system (CPU) and need to be closed." Then this app was specifically shown with CPU usage at 20.66%. I had to uninstalled the app.
Does not send activation code.
Very important and we'll designed application, privacy is protected and will help keep spread under control
Great idea except you should probably make it available to all phones. I know a number of people who want to download the app but can't because it's not supported on their phone
Installed a couple weeks ago. Started off Fine. But has now gone to using 24.7% of battery. So I have uninstalled it.

This app drains your battery like mad. Even with notifications off, it used 11% of my fully charged battery in less than an hour without ever opening the app. I wondered why my phone had been dying so quick lately and ran a diagnostic test.

ABtrace app no good at all this technology can go this far, what a shame!? Terrible dev app!! I signup successfully. Next step is provide abs covid19 information I don't have that. There is no map pop-up say covid19 nearby same like how urber car has like graphic cars moving around without asking abs covid19. And why we need to use bluetoorh it will drainage all the battery. This app should work on wifi or data only if open app. I uninstalled already. I wait for better covid19 trace app.
Great idea - but drains your battery very quickly - constantly trying bluetooth for others... once app installed and setup - battery life averaged 4-5 hours - close to 2 days without the app...
Great idea but this draining if my battery!! Very frustrating 😡

So I don't download a lot of new apps onto my phone and I did add this one and made a good review of IT thinking that it was a great thing to have and I do still think that but here's the problem it screwed my phone up I was lagging freezing my phone would restart it's a good concept guys but you need to fix it because I took it off I need my phone I can't have it glitching like that. Sorry
It was fine until 3 days ago when it went from draining 1% of my battery to >80%. Can't track anything if my phone is dead by 9am. I had to uninstall until this is fixed.

I installed this app, however it was causing issues with some of my other apps and they would not load so I had to uninstall. Once I uninstalled everything else worked fine. Unfortunately the app is not going to be very effective unless more people use it and with all the issues people are having with it fewer people will be using it. I hope you are able to find a solution to those issues and relaunch an app that will be effective. I may consider reinstalling after it is fixed.
total piece of garbage! not only does it NOT work, it violates your privacy! this is sad when there is a known working solution available
I enter my phone number and it keeps saying something went wrong. So I can't even use the damn thing

The first few weeks it was great all around. Last couple of days it has been draining my battery. I've always turned Bluetooth off at home, and on for the occasions I leave the house. It's jumped from 2%, 27%, 48% of battery use! I had to force stop it after Bluetooth off failed to curb its battery appetite.
Very " nice " Thanks !!
It works fine But has sliced my battery life pretty much in half. The app is useless if my phone is dead

I experienced many of the listed faults to this app. Installed as I could understand the advantages and think it's important to help the greater good. However, the battery drainage on my phone will be the reason i uninstall. Would love to reinstall once this is fixed.
Completely useless
Totally drained batter every day!
Installed & activated on Samsung S9 without any issues. Runs fine. There is extra battery usage, but it's tolerable for me.
Amazing app, feels so good to know the government knows all. I cannot wait for the vaccine. Please increase my taxes and fund more the media.
Had to uninstall, this app is a battery eater.
My friend Brian hates this app

Easy to install. Not noticing any power drain and analysis agrees. Bluetooth speaker works fine at same time. Reminds me to turn bluetooth back on when I shut off for a phone call not to be via my bluetooth speaker.
Does it work in Ontario too??
I don't need data on to run it. And it doesn't drain my battery despite having Bluetooth on . So far so good
Seems to be working. If you don't drink the kool-aid, and stay away from Apple this works just fine. I have not even noticed any battery drain on my Android phone.

Have downloaded this on both my mom's and my phone (Samsungs), and haven't had any problems. It only asks for bluetooth to be turned on and for you to enter a phone number to contact you should you encounter someone who later tests positive.
It is utilizing too much battery (39.5%) which is causing me to have to plug in my phone every 4 to 6 hours.

Same as others have said, works fine, installed fine, just wish there was an on /off button for scanning. I can't turn my Bluetooth off because I wear a smartwatch, and I don't need the app when I'm not leaving my house or going anywhere that I will not be in contact with other people. It is a bit of a hindrance having to go in and out of settings all of the time to enable the app permissions, please just add a button to this app.

Unlike others here, my experience is that this app's battery usage on my S9 is very minimal. That is with Bluetooth always being on. I suspect that some people are misreading their battery usage. The problem with having a manual on/off switch is that you will forget to turn the app back on when you go out. My only criticism is that Alberta has not done enough to encourage the public to use this app. As of this writing, there have been only 50,000 downloads.

As so many others are reporting on social media, I tried multiple times but no code was sent to my number. Update: Tried again and it worked, but uninstalled it after it had an undismissable notification when I turned off my Bluetooth when I got home and then stopped working when I turned off push notifications so it would stop doing that. Clunky design.
One rating is for the attempt.

I'm scratching my head wondering if they even tested it out.. First off, I have an older phone (Galaxy S7)), connected to a watch and headphones, adding another connection, especially the way this app works, my battery won't last 2 hours I go through a 20000mah power bank in a day using this app. Also this whole Covid thing is over-exaggerate it's a nasty flu but we will build immunity to it. Shutting down the economy has devasting after-effects. There's an ulterior motive at play..
Was running fine for the first couple of weeks but in the past 2-3 days battery consumption has become intolerable.

I downloaded it on my android phone and it worked okay, but the battery drain is horrible as noted by lots of other users. I was also irritated that despite the fact that they say it only uses bluetooth, location services had to be enabled as well or it wont work. Uninstalled it.

The Bluetooth connectivity was good for the app but it blocked out the ability to use Bluetooth calling, Bluetooth headsets and most other Bluetooth capabilities. This should have been more tested before rolling out. If your devices are unable to play to Bluetooth units Uninstaller this app to get your functionality back. Poor programing.
Destroys your battery. I now have to charge my battery 3 times a day because of this app. It's insane how much battery it uses.
Draining my battery. Did not seem to start until about 1 week after installing it. Sadly had to uninstall.

For the time I had the app installed, it was a constant drain on the battery as well as always dropping the connection. Would start the app and within 5-10 minutes the app would drop. Open another app, the app would drop/stop. Uninstalled, for a tracker this was useless. I've had fitness trackers that work better than this.
Battery drainage not an issue for me, everything works fine. (Galaxy S9)

My wife's phone is only a year old and she is unable to install this app. She gets this device isn't compatible... really I am a software developer and have a decent idea what's involved... I can understand maybe not supporting really old phones but that clearly isn't the case here. Most older people which let's be honest are people that might need this app the most have older technology. A ball has been dropped here.
Seems to work fine on my galaxy note 9. See notification from time to time and thats it. Haven't seen any changes in phone performance and no one for AHS has called. So... happy about that.

Battery consuption is way too high. Currently 13% on a day when I was only out of my house 1 hour. App needs to detect home WiFi and stop scanning unless it detects no wifi. It is the third largest app draining my battery. Not acceptable. May have to discontinue use.

I deal with the public all day so I thought the idea behind the app was great. Knowing you could reach out to anyone I had steady contact with if I ever got sick gave me peace of mind. However, it drains my battery so quickly that I have since deleted the app. I can't have a phone that won't work when I need it to because my battery has died.

Installed without activating the app. After giving it some thought I uninstalled it. I do not trust the current Wildrose Party aka UCP government with unlimited data access. It's easy to see by the number of installs how many Albertans feels the same as I do. I will stay with the simple Federal government app for reporting daily conditions. No name, phone number required. Location only.
Works well on my pixel 3. No issues.
Won't know if it works till it's needed. Hopefully never. Always has a 1 superimposed on the icon, but nothing apparent when I open the app.
Kills your battery
Will not send 6 digit code.
I was totally surprised on how much this app draws dowm my battery , worse than f-cebook app, will be definitely removed once things cool down ...
Used 29% of my battery today, while it was in airplane mode. This needs to be fixed before I'll download it again.
2 weeks and only 10,000 downloads. Seems like a waste if you can't get more people on board.
Kills your battery like your mom does to a piece of cake. 4 hours from full charge, and my phone is almost dead. Useless

I haven't noticed any drastic battery drain on my device yet but as others mentioned the app should be able to be turned off as 95% of my time is spent in my own home. People are more likely to use the app if they don't feel that they don't need it 95% of the time but rather have the option for the 5% of the time it could be helpful.

Running on a Huawei P30 Lite with Android 9 patched to latest. App runs fine and I don't notice any battery drain issues. However, I find that the app self-terminates regularly. I see this when I wake the phone up without entering the password - the status screen shows that the app is running or not. Starting it up is easy - just go to the apps page and start the app again. It's good for anywhere from 1 to 3 days before it dies again. This app seems to strike a decent balance between privacy and usefulness.

Battery drain bluetooth issue fix: you do NOT have to disable bluetooth to disable the app, although this is the easiest and fastest method. The other method is to disable location permissions for the app under apps & notifications tab in phone's settings. This disables the ability for the app to use bluetooth. Another method would be to uninstall the app altogether lol
Will download app if battery drain issues are solved. I use Bluetooth in my home so disabling Bluetooth isn't an option for me

App seems to do what it's designed for. Battery drain doesn't seem an issue on my 2+ year old Galaxy S9. So far today, my phone has been on for 3 hours, the app has been active for less than one minute and running in the background the rest of the time, using 0.2% of my battery in that time, according to my battery stats. Battery usage is negligible. People are going to complain about anything, but this app doesn't seem to deserve the criticism it is getting.

Good app and hopefully it gets installed and used more. Like others are saying, it needs and off button because of the battery drain when using it at home. Most people are at home now so this should be a feature available....

Do I trust the Utterly Corrupt Party government with information about my every movement? Absolutely not. If they really want to make a difference against COVID they can allow the user to control the data. DO NOT RECOMMEND!
Installed easily and seems to work fine.
It was chewing through my battery life. Will come back in 30 days once improved.
No problems, but also I don't get any feedback about whether I'm near another person with the app, so I can't verify whether it's actually doing anything.
Same experience as others. Installed smoothly on my Android 10 device. Report shows that it has used 3% of my battery over the last 3 days.

Works as advertised, used 0% to 1% of battery daily. A must have with the reopening strategy as it will make it easier to stop a second wave and stop the spread. Smart way to prevent a second closure....
Thank you, thank you, thank you! Anything to help keep better tabs on the spread and potential exposure is great.
I dont find any useful this app.. draining battery alot... Disconnect many time.. in day...

Please add an "off" button. I shouldn't have to keep the app running while I'm sleeping or just sitting at home. Turning off bluetooth is not an "off" button since this app isn't the only thing that people use bluetooth for. I don't mind the battery drain since it's a useful app and I think the battery drain, when I want to use the app, is worth it. Would rate 5 stars if you had an off button.

I've had this app installed for a few weeks, this weekend I noticed battery usage of 13.3% in two hours. I did a phone reboot, recharged and tested again. Battery use at 15% for this application, I have removed the app until this issue can be resolved.
Read other reviews, including comments re battery drain. Installed app at about 11.00 am with about 90% battery. By 11.00 pm, down to 15%. About to uninstall.

Good intentions, but battery hog! This thing is a background app, so why does it use the most battery of any app? It sucks up 150% of the battery compared to apps I do actively use a lot! Dead phones don't trace -- they'll need to address this in order to get people on board.
Drained my battery! Downloaded the app yesterday, woke up & my phone was dead. For functionality of Covid-19 tracing, don't we need an app that won't kill off our battery so we can be reached?
Despite claiming that it doesn't recited your location it requires your location to work.
Contact tracing using technology is an obvious and effective way to fight the covid-19 crisis. Well done!
No experience. Just hope it works, it will kill me if I get it with my health issues
Eats your battery and interferes with other apps on my phone that worked perfectly fine before I installed. I have no problem with the info being shared. Just wish it wasn't such a phone killer

Overall, same as other reviews. Installs and runs smooth. The issue is the constant "on" state, with you needing to disable Bluetooth to effectively disable the battery draining searching for other Bluetooth devices. It would be nice to just have a button to click to enable when I leave the house. No need for it to be on when at home, but I'd like to use my headphones please. Thanks!!
Thank you all for your service!!!
Worked for a few days now won't let me upload. No one sends a text either.

Installed the app on two different S8 phones but had to remove because of excessive battery use. Would kill the battery overnight. Battery usage showed between 40% and 70%. This has to be fixed before I will reinstall.
Used 50% if the battery on my S9 in half a day and I never left the house. Good idea but bad implementation. Uninstalled.
Couldn't install in my Android 6.0 phone.
Battery hog! While the app has good intentions it is a major battery hog. Uninstalling it.
The daily power consumption is high. It never runs in the background. Hopefully the next release will reduce per consumption.

Public health is important so an app like this could really help, but having it use Bluetooth drains peoples batteries quickly and the constant notification is very annoying. There are also privacy concerns of course
Keeps resizing my phone wallpaper. Never had this issue till I downloaded this app.
Keeps saying "something went wrong try again"
Cant even put my cell number in. It's a 403 number, so I cant even get in to the app

Won't let me add phone number so I am unable to use this. When I try to add it the app says, "unfortunately something wrong. Please try again."
It's not allowing me to use my phone number. I'm with Roger's and have a S9+

After first successful install there was a notification to restart phone, upon doing so attempted to get onto the app, so uninstalled and tried to reinstall it, it wont accept same phone number again.
I havent experienced any problems or crashings, during registration. So far, it is a good app! My only question is, how reliable is this app?
Battery sucker. Good concept though.
Doesn't let me enter my cellphone number 🙄

I downloaded the app as soon as it was reccomended, and the first few days I didn't notice any issues. Today I noticed my phone battery seemed to be draining far faster than usual. I looked at my Device Care and discovered that while it started off using only 2% of my battery, yesterday that jumped to 11% and today 54.3%. That's not really sustainable for it's intended use. I didn't even leave the house today, but the app's not going to record any data if my battery dies.

Great idea but the app eats battery life to the point where I need to charge in the middle of the day. I got a message regarding my phone needing to shut down software that vanished once I deleted the app. I want to use the app but it just requires to many resources.
Easy to install. However drained my battery in a very short time. Fully charged in the morning down to 15% just before noon. Not practical.

Works as expected. Have not experienced issues with high battery usage. The app has used about 1% over the entire day while the phone is off the charger. Using a Samsung Galaxy S10. Data usage - it has used just under 1 MB in the 4 days installed. 4 stars because the app gives a constant notification that it is in use, but you can't swipe it away. I turned notifications off and will to turn them on when I am out. The app should have a badge system based on consecutive days stayed home!
OK. But it should record any time you're within 2m of another. Not just waiting for 15 minutes. Only takes a second to catch the virus.
The app runs in the background. For those worried about battery drainage, turn off Bluetooth when in your home. I hope this will help AHS deal with COVID19
Easy to install and no noticeable battery drain ... thanks Alberta

I wanted to continue using this app, but unfortunately it eats up too much of my battery- the first day that I had it installed, my phone died after only a few hours with hardly using my phone and settings showed it was majorly consuming power. Had to uninstall!
Great work getting it created quickly!
Drains the battery, not practical leaving Bluetooth on all the time.

Finally got it loaded. The app requires Android 8+ to run so I had to go to my play phone, Copy an image of TWRP to it, Copy an open source zip of Android 10 to it, copy a zip of Opengapps to it, flash the recovery with TWRP, use TWRP recovery to wipe the phone and flash Android 10 and the basic Google apps, then configure the phone and install the app. I took two days to plan it rather than risk bricking the phone. Could they simply have ported to more revisions of Android?

Drained a full batter in less than 4 hours. Now my phone says that this app needs to be closed because it's overloading my CPU. I have a Galaxy S9+. Good idea, needs work if they want people to actually use it.
In 6 hours it drained 22% of my battery on a new note 10. Had to uninstall. Would be great if it didn't kill your phone half way through the day. Can't track anything with your phone dead lol
Constantly trying to pair with my laptop even when it's already paired and connected via Bluetooth.

What is the point if IPhone users can't run their version of the app in the background. No IPhone user is going to have the app running in the foreground with their screen on. Because of the sheer volume of iPhone users this makes the android app pointless.
Not everyone here has a N.A. area code...
No off switch for when you are staying home. High battery usage.
Doesn't send the code,now works

Having an issue where it seems to constantly trigger my laptop to try and pair with it. My phone beeps every couple of minutes and no way to prevent it short of killing the app (or switching off bluetooth). If the devs want to contact me to find out what's happening feel free.
Yes it probably tracks you to see if you have come into contact with someone sick. But drains your phone battery.

Does not work on Samsung S9. After getting code in text message, when I switched to read text message , there is no option to directly come back at fill code screen. I have to reenter the details and 2nd time NEXT button remains disabled.

I don't like the notification that has to be present at all times but oh well. My main complaint is that this app needs to be compatible with older model smartphones. My mother is older and has an older phone as I'm sure many older people do. She now can't use this app even though seniors are the most at risk.

Eats up battery on my Galaxy Note 10 Plus. Typically overnight my phone battery drains 10%. After installing this app, battery drained 40% overnight. Looked in battery usage stats, and saw this app way at the top of the list in terms of battery consumption. Also my Galaxy phone just now popped up a message, warning me that this app is consuming a lot of battery and should be closed. Massive battery drain is a show stopper of a problem! I cannot recommend this app with this current problem.
Got the 6 digit code. Went back into the app to enter the code and it's now locked on the phone number screen.

Terrible for iPhone. Completely unuseable for iPhones. Needs to run in forgeound similar to a navigation app, with screen on. That's a bit of an oversite. Half of population owns an iPhone and they won't be using this app. It's completely rediculous. Please fix this.
Drains battery like crazy so I had to uninstall it. There's an easy replacement, don't leave your house.
Claims to respect your privacy; asks for your phone number. Fail Alberta... Fail!

Had to get code four times because, even though I entered the correct number, it told me either the number was wrong or did nothing at all. Had to press other keys multiple times to get it to advance. Annoying. Hope it works better than the set up.
Easy to install. Would be better if it had a way to pause scanning when just at home.
Just downloaded it last night, so no valid remarks yet. I'll update when I have something useful to say.
Good app. Doing my part to help feels good. Also the more people download this the better the app will work.
Works as advertised.

Works great, but why location? The whole point of the contact tracing API developed by Apple & Google was to facilitate contact tracing without the need for location access. Even from the app description: "The app uses Bluetooth to log contact with other individuals[...]" and "Geolocation data is not collected by the app or by [AHS]". SO WHY DO YOU NEED LOCATION? Please update explanation. Edit: Per AHS website & Android docs, location required for Bluetooth. Please update this in description.
No problems installing or registering.

Obviously I haven't had to use the upload feature and haven't been contacted, so no comment on those features, but installation and verification went smoothly. It has been running issue free over a weekend.
I like the idea however with no ability to turn off when at home or sleeping it is draining the battery way to fast on my brand new phone.

Had troubles getting the code at first, had to delay getting this set up by a day, but got it installed now so maybe they worked out some bugs. Won't really know if it's working unless I get an alert or something. More for their use than mine but I hope it works.
This app shouldn't require a persistent notification. Why didn't we build an app that uses the apple/Google APIs for exposure notification?
I'm happy to help out and participate but persistent notifications are stupid! Allow it to run in the background and not bother me.
It runs just fine in the background and doesn't seem to have any affect on battery

This app is a great idea. At the moment I'm having issues authenticating my phone number with the code. It appears that the code does not send to my phone much similar to what is being reported with many other users. Hope this will be fixed soon.
I have no icon, app doesn't show up in my list of apps, and yet Google play says its installed. How do I know if it's working?
doesn't work, pity you did not test it and if I cannot set it up that mean other people will not be able to either

Works as described. Since people seem to be concerned about the government "having access to your data" it would be good to know if you could toggle data off for the app if it would still be functional. That being said I've had the app for a couple days and it's only used 35 KB of data in the background (1.3 mb foreground). People should probably be more concerned about the data Google, Facebook and other social media has about them.

Issue is finally resolved with SMS validation. It remains to be seen if this will affect battery life but otherwise the app works as intended at this point in time. Thanks for ABGov and AHS for working on new tools rather than focusing on old methodologies alone.
It won't even let me put my number in. Says an error has occured??
Had no issues getting a code & setting up the app
Worked for me. Got my code right away.
So far, so good very little power drain on the cell. I like the privacy options. Especially the deletion of all my data at my request when this pandemic is over.

Seems to run. Enabled sms, got the code right away.
Not very user friendly
Took 1 minute to set up. No issues.
Can't get signed up for the bloody thing. You get a code but can't get it in the space because the app won't let you.

Very cool idea, does not work unless you have a 10-digit phone number. My family and I currently live abroad and have been waiting it out the virus for MONTHS now in our home country. We are constantly outside running and biking, this app would have been useful..
Eady to setup and received my code immediately, great idea to help stop the spread. They don't ask for any personal data just your phone number.
Easy to set up. Works great

Seems to be working fine. Was easy to set up. The only thing I dislike is that it keeps a notification open 24/7 when usually I make sure I've dealt with and gotten rid of all notifications. I'll get used to it, I'm sure.
Downloaded fine / easy to set up. I'd like to see how many downloads have happened.
Code gets sent via SMS. App works as designed.
Download and install was a piece of cake. Glad to do my part.
So far so good, super easy to set up, received my code straight away

Good idea. Had some trouble entering the code to get started. Just waited a few hours and tried again and it worked
Freezes when I try to get the text code. Not useable.

Installed smoothly. "ABTraceTogether is scanning" message need not be displayed constantly in the notification area. It should only appear when it has something to report, especially give the rarity of such an eventuality. Also, it is good design practice that the verification code should always be at the top of the verification text message so that it can be seen in the notification area rather than forcing you to open the message and lose app focus.

Irritating to install. Difficult to for find, even when you enter the name of the app. Then, at Stage 1, you have to exit the app to read the 6 digit code, and it is almost impossible to get back into the app to enter the code! Hopefully works better than the installation.
The registration is still not working!
Technical issues fixed

Had no problems with it. I downloaded it to my laptop, then I synced in with my google and hey presto the app went straight onto my phone. I then was able to get my code verification right away and app is now fully working. You have to make sure you read through the privacy info and check mark otherwise no verification code. Am glad to do it for my self and for others.

So far I have not had a chance to use it since I have not been out yet for groceries, but I think this will help in our fight and prevention in containing outbreaks and know who is and who might not be infected, afterall knowing if half the battle, right? Alberta, share with your friend and families this app, the more people download it,better odds us protected. For me privacy doesn't matter as much as my life or another humans life. Cheers!! #Covid19NotWelcomeHere #AlbertaStrongCovid19Weak
Installed quickly and code was sent almost immediately afterwards. I'm willing to help the AB government in their efforts to trace infection and alert people.
Works as advertised. Easy to install
Got the code to activate right away.
Day 1 the text code didn't work. Day 2 - no problem!!! Give it a day and try again and good to go!
Expires code too quickly. Tried 8 times but couldn't get code in. Uninstalled.

Does not seem like made to help people as it lacks such features. To name a few 1. Need to be able to turn off tracking (like when at home) 2. Show areas with many covid +ve people which we can avoid going to That's what I can think of right now

It installed without issue on my phone and my wife's phone as well. So far I haven't noticed any extra battery drain. I think that the design is clever in that information is not sent until needed. P. S. Note that the notification says "if this notification DISAPPEARS restart your phone".

Absolutely no problems getting the code the first time. Wife had to get the code sent to her a second time (by clicking back and then next during setup). Uses bluetooth (not geolocation) for tracking so it's not tracking where you've been but rather if you've been within 2 meters of another phone with the app using non-idenifying data; all data is scrubbed after 3 weeks. This is an excellent privacy compromise. Absolutely worth it if it helps us all return to normalcy faster.

I download the app, get sent a code, but when I go back into app after retrieving text, the pin screen is gone and there is no way to get back in, it won't even let me re-input my phone number again. I then uninstall, reinstall and start the whole dance again. How do you get back to pin screen?
Add phone number on step 1, wont let you click the next button. Yesterday it wouldnt send me the confirmation text... cmon guys
No opinion yet, but installed and registered without issue. Maybe if it told you how many people it thinks you were near, we could evaluate it's effectiveness.
Easy to install once it was found on Google store. One word name really?????
App timed out before code can be obtained and entered. Tried several times without success. Need more time to enter code.
I blocked notifications for this app to get rid of the persistent notification "Restart this app if this notification..."
Why would you not use this app? The purpose is clearly to the benefit of the whole population, and individuals using the app if there happens to be a contract event.
The issues with getting a code have been sorted. Very easy to setup.

App worked fine on my galaxy s8, but is not compatible with my mothers s6. This is ridiculous! Elderly people are more likely to own older phones. They are also the ones most susceptible to the virus. If there isnt an update soon to increase compatibility, that's a really bad move! It's a great idea and probably works just fine on newer phones, but this is a big issue!

Works great on an Samsung S9. I have two critiques. 1 - Someone in the government must have a contact at Apple to see if theres a way to reduce the steps and way it works on IOS devices. If Apple needs to do an emergency release to help out governments, then that should happen. 2 - When you click on the upload and you get the warning to only do this if you've heard from ABHealth. The next button should be changed to a swipe to make it less likely that its inadvertently pressed. Cheers!
No problem to install

I'm curious about contact tracing for the Covid-19 pandemic. I think the app that is a good compromise between privacy and enabling contact tracing. I'd like to see it us use it in Ontario. I installed the app, registered my phone number, checked that the app was running in background and a short while later de-installed it as I am not an Alberta resident.

If you are having trouble receiving the code, try requesting it at non-peak hours. I downloaded the app during the day and requested the code multiple times without luck. I tried again at 11:00pm and received the code right away.
Nonsense to reject advanced technology and tools in a definitely good way, public health service!

For those who are not getting the text needed to register, please try again when the system isn't so busy. I was only able to register one phone last night. This morning at 6 am I was able to register the other (got the text immediately).
Very easy install. Took a couple seconds to get verification code and activate. Hope I never need it.

Installed at 11pm, no issues with texting code (probably too many people requesting during the day) Once installed, I had a persistent notification so I turned notifications off and back on again (one at a time - Ab TraceTogether, then ACT foreground service and show notification dot) and that resolved the issue.

Technical difficulties, right from the start. Can't get the thing to text me a code, and it only gives you 2 minutes before the code even expires. Was actually looking forward to this app, but currently disappointed.
Update to my previous 2 stars - I was able to easily get the code when I waited till the next morning. So now the real test begins. Does it work as promised?
Loaded well. No issues.
Had to uninstall and reinstall to get activation code to work. Appreciate we have an app for this important cause.
Easy to set up and get going. Glad it can run in the back ground and no need to keep the app open.
Needs to iron out lots of bugs

If you're running a later version of Android, you might have to go into your settings and make sure the app is not optimized in Battery optimization. That way, the app can run in the background, do its job and not get killed by Android. Search for Battery Optimization in your Android settings.
Easy to download and got the code within 10 seconds. Nice to know if you contact someone who later finds out they had covid-19
Installation and activation went smoothly for me. Hopefully the issues others are having are worked out before long. Now to let it do it's thing and hope I never have to be contacted.
Privacy?
Great. Hopefully this comes and gains traction in ontario
App worked great. Got my code right away. Happy to do my part in all of this.
User and life friendly.

If you're having issues getting the SMS 6-digit code, try to unistall and reinstall the app. After that should work fine. Only need to restart phone if you No Longer see the notification as it's no longer running in the background. Great resource and only works if more people have it! Stay safe.
Initially had trouble receiving the confirmation code. I tried later in the evening and received the code within seconds. I'm assuming that was a load base issue, installation is now complete.
So yes it took a couple of tries to get it working. Couldn't get a code but reinstalled and worked fine. Be patient and keep trying. It's worth it for everyone.
Was finally able to register the app

Hubby and I on the Huawei phones and did it at the same time at home and both of us got the code within seconds. He did say though that he tried earlier in the day several times from his work and didn't get the code.
The issue with not receiving the 6 digit confirmation code is resolved now.

Super easy to set up and unlike other reviews, I received my code immediately. It might be a setting issue on people's phones as you need sms enabled. I think this app is so invaluable! What an asset to be notified if someone at the grocery store that you interacted with had covid-19. Great job!

I had no problems, after finding the program. With it installed, I had to swipe my notification screen down to get notification of the message. Selecting that notification, I got the six digit number. Now to just copy it it in, one slight problem they do not give a very long time to find the verification code and input it. I had about thirty seconds left to do so. The normal SMS Messenger alert sign for some reason only showed up after I had gotten the info by swiping my message notifications to show down, and then scrolled to the bottom of the notifications. To soon to tell how the program works, but it does seem to be okay and the set-up was easy.

Working now. I saw all the bad reviews and downloaded anyway. The system may have been overloaded at launch. That's reasonable. Was easy to do.
